fields.headline: Round up
fields.bodyText: Nick Knight led Warwickshire into the semi-finals of the Twenty20 Cup, scoring an unbeaten 69 to set them on course for 54-run victory over Northamptonshire . The opener and captain anchored the Warwickshire innings, seeing them to a total of 202 for five and, in reply, the hosts made 148 for seven. Adam Hollioake was another skipper leading by example. The Surrey captain took five for 21 as the Southern winners completed their group matches with a 19-run victory over Hampshire at the Rose Bowl. The New Zealander Craig Spearman ensured Gloucestershire, already in the semi-finals, signed off in style as he hit seven fours and as many sixes in scoring 88 to help his side to a total of 221 for seven at Bristol against Glamorgan, who were restricted to 168 for seven in reply. Brian Lara made an unbeaten 177 as West Indies reached lunch on 384 for six on the final day of the first Test with Sri Lanka.
